A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
While shot well with decent choreography this episode fails to capture the character and story arc of a character the audience has waited over 30 years to see. This movie has major issues! Huge plot holes! Aliens have been relegated to background and unimportant characters... again\, I'm looking at you Disney!
This movie also fell into the Remake/ Nostalgia trap that plagued episode 7 by borrowing heavily from Empire(5) and Jedi(6).
Jokes in the movie often felt forced. There was a pointless side plot that slowed the movie down and failed to develop the characters involved.
The addition of new Force abilities was undermined by their lack of explanation and their use as plot devices. Rey's lack of training is disappointing and her ease of success discredits the training and legacy of all other trained Jedi!
The movie's continuous chase scene isn't logical and digresses heavily.
The new light speed kamikaze maneuver is visually stunning and terribly effective.
However it creates too many problems to be worthwhile. (Why didn't the other rebel ships about to run out of fuel do that too? Why didn't Holdo do this sooner? Why didn't she do this by auto pilot and save herself? Why doesn't every ship that is about to lose a fight do this? Why don't they have unmanned drone ships do this? Why don't they just strap hyper-drives to asteroids and launch them at the enemy?) Clearly someone didn't think this and other plot points through for more than 5 minutes! I left the theater no longer being interested in this trilogy. I honestly don't care what happens in episode 9 and that is sad. Yes\, I saw the movie multiple times and yes it got worse with repeat viewings.
